intro: Psoralea peratica, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in dry, arid environments. It produces pods that contain small, hard seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptation in challenging environments.
